attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "what is yard management in bolt", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Yard & Warehouse Management
hashtag
Dock & Trip Flow
Optimizing turn-around time (TAT) is the primary goal of the Yard module.
Trip Purpose:
Every vehicle entering the facility must be assigned a purpose (e.g., Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement).
Dock Activity:
Track exactly how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading.
Approval Matrix:
Custom workflows where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor.
Turn-Around Time (TAT) Gauge
circle-info
The TAT Gauge visualizes the average Gate-to-G", "[2] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[3] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house
Home
Start here. Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.
hashtag
Welcome to the BOLT V2 docs
You’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.
This space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.
circle-info
These docs are written for operators and product owners first.
If you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.
hashtag

→ get the big picture, then learn the core concepts.
I’m running ops today
→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions.", "[4] Title: Live Tracking & Remote Operations | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/live-tracking-and-remote-operations
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Live Tracking & Remote Operations
hashtag
Live Tracking & Remote Operations
The tracking interface utilizes
Leaflet
to provide a high-performance, real-time visualization of your fleet.
Visual Overlays:
Toggle between standard road maps, high-resolution satellite imagery, and live traffic data.
Marker Logic:
Vehicle icons change color dynamically based on state:
Green:
Ignition On / Moving.
Yellow:
Idle (Ignition On but stationary).
Red:
Ignition Off.
Grey:
Inactive (No data received for a set period).
hashtag
Vehicle Marker Legend & Status Logic
This page def"], "format_instructions": "If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.
Highlight commands or API names with backticks.
Never hallucinate URLs; always reuse the snippet URLs provided.
Follow the template strictly:
## Direct Answer
<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]
- Another fact
## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]"}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Yard management in Bolt refers to the module designed to optimize the turn-around time (TAT) of vehicles entering and exiting a facility. It involves assigning a purpose to each vehicle, tracking dock activity, and managing approval workflows for gate-in and gate-out events to streamline operations.

## Key Details
- Every vehicle entering the facility is assigned a trip purpose such as Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement to categorize its activity [1].
- The system tracks how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading, helping to monitor and improve efficiency [1].
- An approval matrix allows for custom workflows where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor, ensuring controlled access [1].
- The Turn-Around Time (TAT) Gauge visualizes the average gate-to-gate time, providing a key performance indicator for yard operations [1].

## References
[1] Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management"}

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
Yard management in Bolt refers to the module designed to optimize the turn-around time (TAT) of vehicles entering and exiting a facility. It involves assigning a purpose to each vehicle, tracking dock activity, and managing approval workflows for gate-in and gate-out events to streamline operations.

## Key Details
- Every vehicle entering the facility is assigned a trip purpose such as Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement to categorize its activity [1].
- The system tracks how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading, helping to monitor and improve efficiency [1].
- An approval matrix allows for custom workflows where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor, ensuring controlled access [1].
- The Turn-Around Time (TAT) Gauge visualizes the average gate-to-gate time, providing a key performance indicator for yard operations [1].

## References
[1] Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management"]
